titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Correspondence and subject files of the Director of the Virginia Dept. of Conservation and Recreation, 1958-1989, 1996-2013.
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 31845, 32266, 32548, 32762, 33166, 33518, 33858, 34313, 51260

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Correspondence and subject files of the Director of the Virginia Dept. of Conservation and Recreation,
did.origination: Virginia. Dept. of Conservation and Recreation.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The Dept. of Conservation and Recreation is an outgrowth of the Dept. of Conservation and Economic Development which became known as the Dept. of Conservation and Historic Resources on 1 January 1985. It was later renamed the Dept. of Conservation and Recreation on 1 July 1989 when the Division of Historic Landmarks split off and became its own agency.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and subject files documenting actions, planning, functions, implementation of agency programs, and the establishment of policies and procedures, as well as achievements of the Dept. of Conservation and Recreation and its predecessors. Contains correspondence, news clippings, programs, financial records, memoranda, news releases, newsletters, agendas, minutes, legislative files, state parks and historic sites information, reports, and environmental impact statements.
Includes information on coal mining, forestry, litter control, and mined land reclamation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia. Dept. of Conservation and Recreation. Director's Office. Correspondence and Subject Files. [cite specific date and Accession number used], State records collection, The Library of Virginia, Archives Branch, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Accession 31845 was transferred by the Dept. of Conservation and Economic Development, July 14, 1983.
Accession 33166 was transferred by Department of Conservation & Historic Resources, June 3, 1988
